name: zem
text: leisuretown

name: ham_shoes
text: Goddamn good one

name: gumfish
text: Hell yes, Leisuretown.

name: catachresis
text: A comment left by catachresis was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by twntysevn27, solobuttons, Sweetlips)

name: agika
text: Dr. Andretti knows that the only thing you can do is put him out of hia misery.

name: spinynorman
text:
In Holland the doctor has a place to send people when they need to be killed.

The Dutch are so advanced.

name: laserblade
text: This is the box where the children shall die

name: djorra
text: Nice avvy-comment synergy.

name: cracklewater
text: Doctor Andretti has his pro ice game face on.

name: untilyouaresonude
text:
Couldn't Beef just use his spinal wireless from when he got shot?

Sorry if that makes me sound like a continuity-douche.

It does, doesn't it....dammit.

name: centipede_damascus
text: Beef's spinal wireless is too dang slow.

name: theguitarhero
text:
If your internet is down you can't connect to a WAP.

The bullet in his spine merely allows him to connect to said WAP.

name: dusty
text: That's true, it's just a wireless receiver, not some kind of satellite modem, that would be ridiculous.

name: luke_johnson
text: Maybe he couldn't stand using it because it was too slow.

name: rapid_roy
text: This is one of the best Beef freak-outs because I could see it happening to me...to a lesser degree.

name: radarjammer
text: Every joke needs a bit of truth and an exaggeration on the truth.

name: rocket6240
text: I can imagine Roast Beef relating well with Toothepaste For Dinner. all hell of dejected.

name: fineoakstructure
text: Except for Beef is funny on more than a biannual basis, unlike Toothpaste for Dinner.

name: quantumcasaba
text: I like older Toothpaste for Dinner. Same with Married to the Sea.

name: presterjohn
text: xkcd avatar ...

name: quantumcasaba
text:
Is this a faux pas of which I am unaware?
Hello, bottle I cannot read.

name: relaxing
text:
Sometime the earnestness of xkcd makes me uncomfortable.


D-does that make me a bad person?

name: presterjohn
text: Eventually the response to "he's a geek in love-and-or-heartbreak" must turn from "awwww" to "what, again?"

name: quantumcasaba
text: :shrug: I don't think it's the holy grail of web comics, I just like it as an avatar.

name: relaxing
text: Pictures for Sad Children is a huge upgrade. Chubby.

name: radarjammer
text: Nope. The earlier strips (up to 100 or so) were really grating; like you I thught it was too sugary. For example, the boy in a barrel looking for his mommy was NOT entertaining; about 1/3 of the way through the catalgue the comic hits it's stride, I think. 200-now has some real gems; I get a good laugh out of about every other strip.

name: relaxing
text: true, although i liked the mommies one... :\

name: greenkoolayd
text: pictures for sad children?

name: achilleselbow
text: At least he doesn't read the god-awful hipster soap opera that is Questionable Content.

name: ted0phile
text:
I actually like Questionable Content, mostly because it introduces me to new bands, for instance, the Fiery Furnaces. And to a lesser extent, because the soap opera aspects are nauseatingly addictive.

You get a chubby for having a different opinion than me.

name: aliiis
text: You get a chubby for the best chubby-giving reasoning.

name: achilleselbow
text: As do you.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
Is this the first achilleselbow "I hate QC" post?

Just wondering, it's for History.

name: aelindil
text: You explained this very well and did it graciously.  I am both impressed and cheered by the idea that such an exchange can happen on an internet message board.

name: prettyrad
text:
Beef is totally in tune with the linguistics of TFD. And that kind of desperate lashing out at the world, beyond anger, that just turns into humourous futility...
Wait, I never saw TFD like this before I wrote this. Daaaaaaaaaaaaang.

name: cdl146
text: I enjoy the inclusion of slashdot. RB is definitely a slashdot kind of guy.

name: tony
text: aminakedornot.com too

name: relaxing
text: "Is she naked...?  Ehhh!"

name: evolume
text:
haha, beef all looking at goth boobs @ suicidegirls.com
i admit i looked at some of those. is it stalagmite or stalactite when they hang down?

name: audhumla
text: stalactites gotta hold on tite so they don't fall ;)

name: charchar
text: I remember it as stalactite has a C as in 'ceiling' and stalagmite has a G as in 'ground.'

name: tekende
text: This is how I do it too!

name: awko
text: When the 'mites go up, the 'tites come down.

name: miku224
text: You can have this maglite, it survived the apocalypse.

name: rowboat
text: That was my favorite site when I first got a computer. That was before I realized that only suckers pay for porn, here.

name: jesler729
text: This is my favourite Achewood strip. Easily. God, it's so good.

name: _cheesekayke
text:
This has happened to me.
Incidentally, the "single bullet" Beef refers to in the last panel - is that Beef committing suicide or Dr. Andretti putting him out of his misery?

name: tim88
text:
$5 if you can shoot yourself in the base of the skull.

I demand your wager up front, though.

name: stuart
text: I can demonstrate with airsoft pellets.

name: stormagnet
text: Maybe he's just upgrading his connection?

name: stuart
text: This wouldn't have happened with RSS

name: stuart
text: wait yes it would

name: dasilodavi
text: Remember that show My Brother and Me on Nickelodeon?  The kids' Family Matters?  Remember the girl who was really pessimistic all the time?  This is like that, only funny.

name: shankley
text: A comment left by shankley was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by tekende, divot, cailetshadow, erinye)

name: adhesion
text: I never noticed the little 'poof' the computer makes when it crashes until now. Amazing.

name: mattylite
text: Wow, that's the same 'poof' Beef made when Ray woke him up here .

name: twntysevn27
text: I went for a week without internet while moving into my new apartment...I went through that exact same anxious fear before the cable guy came to install the modem. Bullet to the base of the skull.

name: falseprophet
text:
Beef's depression has such great rhythm:

I feel like I'm just gonna start typin' URLS like crazy
URLs just flowin' outta my memory
Typin' so fast my fingers blur
Browser completely freezin' up
Computer hella crashin' and goin' black
Everyone in the doorway all starin' at me
Still typin' like mad, huge scared eyes
Doctor comes in, he's seen it before
Single bullet to the base of my skull
That's the quickest way.

name: hellofditties
text: OH SHIIIIIIIIT.

name: falseprophet
text: OOPS POW SURPRISE! OHHHHHHHH!

name: landowmpg
text: This racism is killing me inside

name: gormster
text: "OH. HI. YEAH, IT HASN'T BEEN UP IN THREE DAYS."

name: charchar
text: Beef digs Fortean Times?  They still publish Fortean Times?

name: fermatprime
text: Yeah, I can't really see Beef as all that into Forteana -- all hell of weird, all contradicting his basically scientific mind. But maybe it's like airshow disasters, and he reads it because it feeds his anxiety.

name: crankheart
text: oh dear...i feel this way about the plethora of webcomics i read.

name: singtralala
text: i call this one "monday"

name: jhunter
text: only Beef could turn "ComCast ain't fixed your cable internet yet?!" to the topic of euthanasia

name: ham_shoes
text: Only in daydreams does Lyle show as much sympathetic concern as in Panel 7

name: daaaaang
text: Roast Beef feels like he has to check PayPal.com

name: lolsworth
text: Don't read the Drudge Report, Beef! The Drudge Report is silly! It is silly to read the Drudge Report!

name: dusty
text:
People have probably seen this, but this has to be RB's actual cat counterpart
http://cheezdailysquee.files.wordpress.com/2010/05/129186716904462678.jpg

name: dybrar
text: That is one dejected-looking kitty.

name: johnnybaverage
text: Awww, poor achondroplasic kitty.
